page.title: 03LLANGADOG C.P. SCHOOL
page.content: The stone built school was opened in 1874.In 1961 two classrooms and a cloakroom were added.The indoor toilets were built in 1982.The school accommodation at present is 4 classrooms and a hall.Of the 76 pupils, 38 are girls and 38 are boys. The age of the children are 4-11 years old who are taught by Mr R.C.Williams, headteacher,who lives in Llangadog,Mrs O.Marsland,deputy headteacher who lives in Llansadwrn and Miss D.Evans who lives in Llandeilo.43 children 43 children live in the village, 33 outside the village.33 are from Welsh speaking homes,43 from English speaking homes. 75 children stay for school dinners,1 goes home for dinner, 37 children walk to school, 37 come by car and 2 come on a bicycle.41 of the children in the school are juniors and 36 are infants.
